description: This source file implements the operations for the Ansc Daemon Engine Tcp Object, including starting, stopping, canceling pending send requests, cleaning socket table, taking snapshots for diagnostics, and closing-up procedures. It contains functions that manage TCP socket connections within the daemon engine, handling lifecycle events and diagnostic data collection.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDetoStart(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Starts the TCP daemon engine, resetting internal states, spawning receive and optionally send tasks if asynchronous send flag is set.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDetoStop(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Stops the TCP daemon engine, waits for ongoing events to terminate, and resets internal states.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDetoCancel(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hSocket)
methods.description: Cancels pending send requests associated with a specific socket, notifying the worker accordingly.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDetoClean(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Cleans up the socket table by identifying sockets to be cleaned (e.g., due to timeout or being marked for deletion) and notifying the worker for each.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDetoSnapshot(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hForm)
methods.description: Collects current connection states and socket information for diagnostic purposes, filling a snapshot form.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscDetoCloseUp(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject,ANSC_HANDLE hForm)
methods.description: Fills a close-up form with detailed information about each socket's state for diagnostics, including start time, last activity, and byte counts.
